segment.source: Monitoring Web Service Request Performance Counters
segment.target: Monitoring Web Service Request Performance Counters

segment.source: Monitoring Web Service Request Performance Counters
segment.target: Monitoring Web Service Request Performance Counters

segment.source: Monitoring Web Service Request Performance Counters
segment.target: Monitoring Web Service Request Performance Counters

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) provides performance counters that record the performance of requests that are sent to the following web services:
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) provides performance counters that record the performance of requests that are sent to the following web services:

segment.source: StatusReportingService.svc – service that receives requests for compliance status
segment.target: StatusReportingService.svc – service that receives requests for compliance status

segment.source: CoreService.svc – service that receives requests for key recovery attempts
segment.target: CoreService.svc – service that receives requests for key recovery attempts

segment.source: Performance counters that MBAM provides
segment.target: Performance counters that MBAM provides

segment.source: MBAM provides the following performance counters for each of the public methods that is implemented by its StatusReportingService and CoreService web services:
segment.target: MBAM provides the following performance counters for each of the public methods that is implemented by its StatusReportingService and CoreService web services:

segment.source: Type of performance counter
segment.target: Type of performance counter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Total number of requests
segment.target: Total number of requests

segment.source: Provides an incrementing count that starts from zero when the server is started or restarted.
segment.target: Provides an incrementing count that starts from zero when the server is started or restarted.

segment.source: Provides an overall view of system activity.
segment.target: Provides an overall view of system activity.

segment.source: Can be monitored by automated tools to ensure the health of the server and to validate that the counter continually increments over a specified period of time.
segment.target: Can be monitored by automated tools to ensure the health of the server and to validate that the counter continually increments over a specified period of time.

segment.source: Requests per second
segment.target: Requests per second

segment.source: Indicates the current throughput of the MBAM Server as it supports the MBAM client base.
segment.target: Indicates the current throughput of the MBAM Server as it supports the MBAM client base.

segment.source: Enables site administrators to:
segment.target: Enables site administrators to:

segment.source: Calculate the average number of requests per second, based on the number of MBAM Clients and their reporting frequency.
segment.target: Calculate the average number of requests per second, based on the number of MBAM Clients and their reporting frequency.

segment.source: Validate that the number of requests per second broadly correlates with the calculated average number of requests per second.
segment.target: Validate that the number of requests per second broadly correlates with the calculated average number of requests per second.

segment.source: A significant variance can indicate that the MBAM Client isn't installed on a percentage of the client base or that an MBAM Group Policy Object hasn't been successfully deployed.
segment.target: A significant variance can indicate that the MBAM Client isn't installed on a percentage of the client base or that an MBAM Group Policy Object hasn't been successfully deployed.

segment.source: Request duration
segment.target: Request duration

segment.source: Records the duration of requests in milliseconds.
segment.target: Records the duration of requests in milliseconds.

segment.source: Although this counter is updated with the duration of each request, Windows Performance Monitor samples it only periodically (typically every second), so you might see some variability in the value.
segment.target: Although this counter is updated with the duration of each request, Windows Performance Monitor samples it only periodically (typically every second), so you might see some variability in the value.

segment.source: For this reason, consider using the average value displayed by Performance Monitor.
segment.target: For this reason, consider using the average value displayed by Performance Monitor.

segment.source: Performance counter results and recommendations
segment.target: Performance counter results and recommendations

segment.source: As you add new MBAM Clients to an MBAM Server with spare capacity, expect to see an increase in the number of requests per second.
segment.target: As you add new MBAM Clients to an MBAM Server with spare capacity, expect to see an increase in the number of requests per second.

segment.source: This increase will be proportional to the number of new client computers.
segment.target: This increase will be proportional to the number of new client computers.

segment.source: The average request duration will remain relatively static.
segment.target: The average request duration will remain relatively static.

segment.source: As the server nears its maximum capacity, the requests per second start to level out, and the average request duration starts to get longer.
segment.target: As the server nears its maximum capacity, the requests per second start to level out, and the average request duration starts to get longer.

segment.source: If you are concerned about whether your MBAM Servers can support your client base, consider deploying MBAM in phases across different collections of client computers.
segment.target: If you are concerned about whether your MBAM Servers can support your client base, consider deploying MBAM in phases across different collections of client computers.

segment.source: As you deploy MBAM to each collection of client computers, we recommend that you take snapshots of the performance counters to see the relative impact of deploying to each new client collection.
segment.target: As you deploy MBAM to each collection of client computers, we recommend that you take snapshots of the performance counters to see the relative impact of deploying to each new client collection.

segment.source: If the number of requests per second starts to level off and the average request duration increases, consider enhancing your MBAM Server infrastructure by doing one of the following:
segment.target: If the number of requests per second starts to level off and the average request duration increases, consider enhancing your MBAM Server infrastructure by doing one of the following:

segment.source: Moving the MBAM database onto a dedicated Microsoft SQL Server or SQL Server cluster
segment.target: Moving the MBAM database onto a dedicated Microsoft SQL Server or SQL Server cluster

segment.source: Load-balancing MBAM across multiple Internet Information Services (IIS) web servers
segment.target: Load-balancing MBAM across multiple Internet Information Services (IIS) web servers

segment.source: Deploying MBAM on more powerful server hardware
segment.target: Deploying MBAM on more powerful server hardware

segment.source: Viewing performance counters
segment.target: Viewing performance counters

segment.source: The recommended tool for viewing MBAM performance counters is Windows Performance Monitor, which comes with Windows.
segment.target: The recommended tool for viewing MBAM performance counters is Windows Performance Monitor, which comes with Windows.

segment.source: If you are using Windows PowerShell, you don’t need to enable the counters before viewing them, as they are automatically registered by the Windows PowerShell Enable-webapplication cmdlet.
segment.target: If you are using Windows PowerShell, you don’t need to enable the counters before viewing them, as they are automatically registered by the Windows PowerShell Enable-webapplication cmdlet.

segment.source: For detailed instructions on how to view performance counters, see How to View MBAM Performance Counters.
segment.target: For detailed instructions on how to view performance counters, see How to View MBAM Performance Counters.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.

segment.target: Related topics
